locutie.beschrijving: The sermon contrasts the superficial 'beautiful people' of high society and power with the spiritual beauty granted by Christ through communion with God.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher uses John 17 as a springboard for a character study on Jesus' prayer life rather than a verse-by-verse exegesis.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher begins by ASSERTING the vanity of the world, then shifts to PROMISING the beauty of Christ to the believer.
voorbeelden: I point to the power brokers in industry and government.
The glory given to the man Christ Jesus becomes ours by the gift of Jesus.
Rejoice, Christian, rejoice evermore.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from envy of worldly status to a sense of spiritual dignity and joy in Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the 'event', though the 'climate of God' is central.

voorbeelden: They are the people who show up at places.
Jesus moved in a climate full of the presence of God.
There is the illusion abroad that life can be made beautiful.
Pity them!
Listen and see if you catch some of that theme.
Rejoice, Christian, rejoice evermore.
I know for a fact...
We discover to our sadness...
Thank God, as we used to sing...
We shall walk through this valley in peace.
The fire shall not burn us.
The waters shall not overflow us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High. The use of 'shall' creates a strong sense of divine promise.

voorbeelden: He has made us princes and princesses.
He sets us down at his table.
He has put on us his royal robe.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong. The preacher speaks as a mandatory of the Gospel's reality.

indicatoren: Long descriptions of society columnists and Gucci fashion.
Extended historical/biographical description of Jesus' prayer habits.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of a lecture on 'beauty' for the first two-thirds of the sermon.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the hearer's specific sins.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only starts in the final quarter.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Very high in the conclusion; uses the 'royal line' of promise.
voorbeelden: Christ gives us the glory that the Father gave him.
We now own all that Christ has.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the 'Christian' and the 'envy' of the hearer.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the promises of the 'shall' sentences.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a long descriptive 'talking about' phase.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about sin and beauty.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the Assertive (world is ugly) to the Commissive (Christ shall protect) to the Declarative (He has made us princes).
voorbeelden: Assertive: 'Sin soils and sours our lives.' -> Commissive: 'We shall walk through this valley in peace.' -> Declarative: 'He has made us princes and princesses.'
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The movement is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Christ has taken us in (Indicative) ... Rejoice (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to comfort the marginalized by bestowing a new identity (glory) through the promise of Christ.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: We shall look evil and sickness... in the face and say... My Father is my protection.
sterke_punten.effect: Creates a shield of faith for the hearer.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The term beautiful people was originated by society columnists...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too much time spent on social commentary before the Word is addressed.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The ending transforms the sermon into an event of 'bestowal' (toezegging).
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher successfully uses declarative language ('He has made us kings') to change the hearer's status.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicit. The preacher speaks 'for' the text's authority.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the final 'Rejoice' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: Christ gives to us his glory.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'pull at the heartstrings'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the 'royal line' to heaven.
tekstueel_bewijs: He empties his blessing in our hands.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on descriptive 'is/are' verbs in the first half, but transitions to strong 'shall/has' verbs in the second half.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The glory given to the man Christ Jesus... becomes ours.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I announce to you today: the very glory of Jesus is now yours.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a theological fact to a personal bestowal.

voorbeeldzinnen: You shall walk in the sunshine of His love.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much third-person 'they' in the beginning.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Connect the 'they' of the rich to the 'you' of the hearer's envy sooner.
voorbeeldzinnen: You might envy them, but I tell you...

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of how a sermon can move from social observation to sacramental bestowal. The ending is illocutionarily masterful.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about his colleague Sandy Ray; SAT focuses on the 'Commissive' act of God's promise through the preacher.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'beautiful people' imagery; SAT looks at whether the 'glory' is actually transferred to the hearer via the word.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the shift from 'talking about' Jesus' prayer to 'performing' the blessing Jesus prayed for.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them.
kernzinnen_analyse.illocutionaire_kracht: Scriptural warrant for the preacher's act.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: We shall walk through this valley in peace.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic African American homiletic 'climax' where the performative force increases toward the end.
